task.title: Transferring Currency Balances Between Wallets
task.shortdesc: How to send digital currencies from one digital-currency wallet to another, either between your own accounts or to a third-party recipient, using Bitcoin as an example.

taskbody.prereq: Complete the instructions described in CoinbaseAccount.dita and PoloniexAccount.dita, and exchange your local currency for Bitcoin using your Coinbase account.
taskbody.context: The following steps will teach you how to send and receive digital currencies from your Coinbase and Poloniex accounts, using a transfer from your Coinbase account to your Poloniex account as an example. Completing this task will give you first-hand experience in safely performing these transfers.

step.cmd: Log in to your account on Poloniex.
After logging in to Poloniex, select "Balances" from the website header.
Choose "Balances and Withdrawals" from the dropdown menu.
On the "Balances, Withdrawals, and Holdings" page for your Poloniex account, you will see a table listing the total digital currencies that a user may hold in a Poloniex account.

For the purposes of these instructions, please locate "BTC" in the table's "Coin" column. On the far right of that row, you should see links for both "Deposit" and "Withdrawal." Please select the "Deposit" link.

After clicking the "Deposit" link, copy the text representing the depost address of the digital wallet that will receive your upcoming transfer from Coinbase. (Tip: paste this text into a temporary document.) You may also choose to reveal the depost address of your digital wallet as a QR code:
Log in to your account on Coinbase.
Select the "Accounts" tab at the top of the Coinbase website .

Though you may choose the Bitcoin, Ethereum, or Litecoin "wallet" from which you would like to perform a transfer to your Poloniex account, please choose your Bitcoin wallet for the purposes of completing this task.
After choosing your Bitcoin wallet, click on the "Send" icon:
Clicking the "Send" icon from Step 10 will produce the following pop-up from the Coinbase website:

Copy the digital deposit address from your Poloniex account into the "Recipient" field shown in the image accompanying Step 11. Add any note you find appropriate to append to this transfer, and hit "Continue."
Coinbase will produce a final pop-up to verify your transfer request, which you can verify by selecting "Confirm."
After you have hit confirm, Coinbase will provide you with a link to a page on BlockCypher that you can use to wach the progress of your transaction in real time.
When the transaction details listed on BlockCyber have received six or more confirmations from transaction processors, the transaction has been completed.

Return to your Poloniex account, and you now will see the amount you transferred from the Bitcoin wallet of your Coinbase account now appears among the total holdings of Bitcoin in your account own Poloniex.
